intro: Ravenella angustiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ravenella, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces edible fruits that are typically consumed fresh or used in local cuisines. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
